newsitem.title: LATVIA: Gazprom, Ruhrgas/Preussen sign Latvian Gas deal.
newsitem.headline: Gazprom, Ruhrgas/Preussen sign Latvian Gas deal.

text.p: German firms Ruhrgas and Preussen and Russian Gazprom on Wednesday formally signed the deal under which they will acquire some 32.5 percent of the shares of Latvian Gas.
"This agreement is very interesting for us as suppliers of gas," Gazprom chairman Rem Vyakhirev told a news conference.
Preussen and Ruhrgas formed a consortium to buy 16.25 percent of Latvian Gas while Gazprom bought its stake as a separate partner.
"Latvian Gas will gain a lot from this agreement as all the parties are very competent energy producers," Ruhrgas board vice-chairman Burckhard Bergmann said.
Latvian Gas is one of the first of Latvia's utilities to be sold and electricity producer Latvenergo is also undergoing privatisation.
